fwiw, scientists (a) don't know when someone buys their article and (b) get NO money from that. The publisher gets ALL the money. And you know what's even crazier? We have to pay the publisher's "publication fees" after the article has been peer-reviewed and approved by the reviewers for publication. So the publisher is getting paid both on the front end and back end for every journal article.

I found a quora thread on the question https://www.quora.com/Do-genitals-have-taste-buds. One of the comments mentioned receptors similar to the tongues taste receptors, can for example be found inside your testes and play a role in the regulation of sperm production. Is cites a business Insider article https://www.businessinsider.fr/us/taste-receptors-in-testes-and-fertility-2013-7, and a PNAS article https://www.pnas.org/content/110/30/12319. So while you don't have tastebuds on the outside of your scrotum, you have some inside your testicles.
